node.title: Today is expected to be the peak of what has already been a thoroughly drenching system
node.alt: Dark rain clouds gather over a golden field
node.description: There is still more rain to come for the soggy east coast, but it is finally looking like there could be a bit of a break next week.Â
node.content:
["Today is expected to be the peak of what has already been a thoroughly drenching system.\u00a0", "According to Jackson Browne, senior meteorologist with the Bureau of Meteorology, a\u00a0low pressure system currently sitting around the South Australian border region north of Broken Hill\u00a0is forecast to edge in a south-easterly direction over the next couple of days.", "\"This system really begins to stand up today,\" he said.\u00a0", "Bringing with it is a renewed band of rain.\u00a0", "Flood watches\u00a0extend\u00a0from around Clermont, north of Emerald in Queensland and persist south through much of New South Wales and parts of eastern South Australia as well as for\u00a0parts of northern and eastern Victoria.", "\"In terms of relative risk today being the peak day of rainfall,\" according to Mr Browne.\u00a0", "", "
There was flash flooding at Moore Park Beach after 201mm of rain fell in 24 hours this week.(ABC Wide Bay: Brad Marsellos)
", "The rain-band is expected to stretch\u00a0from around\u00a0Charters Towers south through\u00a0much of NSW and wrap\u00a0into that low, bringing rain to southern NSW and Victoria.\u00a0", "Rainfall is expected to be in the order of 25 up to 100 millimetres in places.\u00a0", "\"If you get under a thunderstorm or severe thunderstorm, we could say falls exceeding even 100 millimetres,\" according to Mr Browne.\u00a0", "The low is expected to trundle\u00a0into southern NSW\u00a0on Friday before\u00a0weakening late Friday.", "\"By Saturday we should see most of the activity in New South Wales and Victoria cease,\" he said.\u00a0", "But there will be a further day of rain for\u00a0parts of Queensland on Saturday.", "Mr Browne said there was not a lot of rain overnight,\u00a0but things have started picking up again this morning.\u00a0", "\"In the last hour, we've seen up to 30 millimetres around the Clermont area.\"", "Since 9am yesterday falls of up to 100mm have been recorded in the\u00a0Border Rivers area around\u00a0Mount Tambourine in Queensland.\u00a0", "A\u00a0slow moving thunderstorm outside of Sydney at Warragamba, also brought 96mm in a very short period of time.", "
Get used to it
", "It has been raining for days in places like Brisbane.\u00a0", "With the\u00a0La Ni\u00f1a climate driver now in full swing and expected to hang around until January,\u00a0Mr Browne said it is\u00a0no surprise that Brisbane is rainy with the climate driver just sitting off offshore.", "\"So yeah, buckle up. It's only the third week of November and we're expecting La Nina to persist until late January.", "\"It will be a wet couple of months for those in eastern Australia,\" he said.\u00a0", "
Short break in sight
", "But it is looking like there will be a short break in the clouds as a high pressure system settles in across the country next week.\u00a0", "\"It's looking more likely than not. Some of the models aren't playing ball,\" Mr Browne prefaced.\u00a0", "So with a bit of luck we will get an episode of quieter conditions.", "The catch is it could be a bit chilly.", "\"Probably 80 per cent\u00a0of the country two to eight degrees below the average for this time of year,\" said Mr Browne.\u00a0", "\"I feel like people could make some decisions if they know it's going to be a somewhat dry couple of days.\"\u00a0", "Enjoy it while it lasts.\u00a0", "
Away from the east coast
", "There have been some fairly intense storms around the Top End, but nothing record breaking, according to Mr Browne.\u00a0", "Just upstream of Katherine at Upper Waterhouse they did\u00a0receive\u00a092mm\u00a0in a slow moving storm.\u00a0", "Looking west,\u00a0Perth is forecast to reach\u00a035 degrees Celsius\u00a0on Saturday.", "\"If that forecast comes off, it'll be the first 35C plus day in Perth since late March,\" Mr Browne said.\u00a0", "Another sign summer is almost here, if\u00a0all the tropical\u00a0rain wasn't enough.\u00a0"]
